page.title: 09SADDLEWORTH WORKHOUSE
page.content: This was opened in 1816 & was situated at Running Hill. It was reputed to be less severe than many of the similar establishments throughout the country. At one time known as Saddleworth Union, it linked Boundary Park in Oldham & Crossley Moor, where inmates were finally taken. Such institutions were very necessary in the early 19th. century due to the growth in the local textile industry because of national variations in the trade cycle. It is said that very soon, Saddleworth Workhouse was giving weekly relief to over 3000 people, at a time when the average weekly earnings for local weavers was only 5/-. The residents were utilised in several ways, including carting coal from Diggle Station, which was down the hill. The workhouse closed in the 1930's & is now Running Hill Farm (Shepherds).
